column4: hello, i am trying a custom-install of ubuntu, but i cannot install xdm or icewm. "sudo apt-get install xdm" says there is no package to install, same for icewm
do i have to update somekind of "portage tree"?
yes, you need to run sudo apt-get update ( and probably edit your /etc/apt/sources.list )
you need at least the universe repo
read your personal messages from ubotu
thanks, i read it standby ;)
ubuntu says deb is an unknown command
deb isn't a command
i read it in the docs u sent me
I strongly suggest you read  help.ubuntu.com
it should be used to put ubuntus archives in the sourcelist
no, you have misunderstood
read the help.ubuntu.com URL for help understanding the system
i dont want to read the whole manual. it is just one step i have to understand
where can i finde the sources.list?
remove the # marks from the "universe" lines in /etc/apt/sources.list
and is "nano" already installed?
use the nano editor - sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list
yes it is installed
thanks
after you edit the sources.list you need to run   sudo apt-get update  before installing icewm  etc
yeah, i think that was the problem ;)
it works :) thank you for support
no worries :)
